hackathon-description-text: Brooklyn Tech Triangle and TENDIGI are teaming up to present the second annual Tech Triangle U Mentorship Hacakthon.
hackathon-eligibility:
The event is open to all university students in teh Brooklyn Tech Triangle (grad, undergrad, and law) and recent grads of all experience levels interested in getting involved in the entrepreneurial, design, and tech world in Brooklyn.  
Not just for tech students! We want students interested in business development, strategy, PR, and marketing, as well as those interested in programming and designing for iOS, Android, HTML, Javascript ,PHP, and Python.
hackathon-requirements:
2. Hardware Device
3. Demonstration (video or interactive media - not a PowerPoint)
4. One or more screenshots of your product
hackathon-rules:
1. Team must have a minimum of three people, with at least one non-technical student and one tech student on the team
2. Teams are capped at 8 students
3. Teams must consult with a mentor before presenting

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The winning team will receive $1,000.  And bragging rights of, course.

Each member of the winning team will receive a Businessworld Gold Card that would allow them access to over 2,000 locations around the world, including our location here in Brooklyn.  Drop in, jump on the internet and have refreshments while having access to a network of business professionals.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Runner Up - One Year Membership to Regus Business Lounge

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Creativity and originality of the idea
Identification of clear market, potential impact, and strategies for revenue + overcoming challenges
Execution of idea into a professional presentation, functioning app, software or hardware product.
